prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: All I did was support Clay over my shoulder and get us out of the rocket!
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 1
Testimony: Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor.
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 2
Testimony: Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate.
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 3
Testimony: I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!
Person: Starbuck

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the details provided.

First, the characters involved include Athena Cykes, Phoenix Wright, Apollo Justice, Trucy Wright, Clay Terran (the victim), Juniper Woods, Solomon Starbuck (the defendant), Simon Blackquill, Bobby Fulbright, Candice Arme, Yuri Cosmos, Ponco, Aura Blackquill, and Clonco.

The evidence listed includes various items like the attorney's badge, autopsy report, diagrams, utility knife, bombing report, evacuation report, door locks, security camera video, oxygen tank data, pamphlets, bullet holes, lighter, and bullet from Arme's gun.

The testimonies come from Starbuck, who claims he was trying to save Clay and didn't kill him.

Looking for contradictions, I'll compare each testimony with the evidence.

Testimony 0: Starbuck says he supported Clay and got them out of the rocket. Evidence 7 is the security camera video showing Starbuck and Clay escaping. If the video stops right after they enter the boarding lounge, it doesn't show the stabbing, which might contradict Starbuck's claim of innocence.

Testimony 1: Starbuck describes his evacuation path, but if the door lock evidence (6) shows his prints, it might imply he was present.

Testimony 2: He claims Clay was unconscious when they evacuated. Evidence 1's autopsy report says Clay was stabbed, implying he was alive when attacked, possibly contradicting Starbuck's timeline.

Testimony 3: He denies killing Clay. Evidence 14 mentions a lighter with Earth emblem, which might link to the crime, but no direct contradiction yet.

The most direct contradiction seems to be between Testimony 0 and Evidence 7. If the video stops when they enter the lounge, it doesn't show the stabbing, but Starbuck's claim of innocence isn't directly contradicted. However, if the video doesn't show the attack, it leaves doubt about his involvement.

Alternatively, Testimony 2 and Evidence 1 might contradict. If Clay was stabbed, he was likely conscious, contradicting Starbuck's claim that Clay was passed out.

I think the best pair is Testimony 2 and Evidence 1, as the autopsy showing a stabbing suggests Clay was alive when attacked, conflicting with Starbuck's claim that Clay was unconscious.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the situation.

We have a defendant, Solomon Starbuck, who is accused of killing Clay Terran. The evidence includes various items like the autopsy report, space center diagrams, utility knife, bombing report, evacuation report, door locks, security camera video, oxygen tank data, pamphlet, bullet hole, control room door lock, bullet, "Hope" capsule, Aura's statement, bullet from Arme's gun, and a lighter.

The testimonies are from Starbuck himself. In his testimonies, he's trying to explain his escape route. Initially, he says he took a different route, but then he clarifies that he took a specific path with the capsule and Clay.

Looking at the evidence, the Space Center Diagram (Evidence 2) shows the layout, including the boarding lounge where the victim was found. The Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows Starbuck and Terran escaping from the corridor to the boarding lounge, but the video ends right after that scene. This suggests that the last known location of both men was the boarding lounge.

Now, Starbuck's testimony says he took a different route and made his way down from the upper level with the capsule and Clay. However, the security camera video contradicts this because it shows him escaping to the boarding lounge, not taking a different route. If the video ends there, it implies that they were in the boarding lounge, which aligns with the autopsy report that says Clay was found there.

So, the contradiction is between the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) and Starbuck's testimony where he claims a different escape route. The video shows him going to the boarding lounge, but he says he took a different path. This inconsistency suggests that his testimony might not be truthful.

Another point is the Oxygen Tank Data (Evidence 8), which shows that Clay's tank was ruptured. If Starbuck was trying to save Clay, he would have needed to get him to safety, but the evidence suggests that Clay was killed in the boarding lounge, which might not align with Starbuck's claim of escaping with him.

Also, the Bullet Hole (Evidence 10) and Bullet from Arme's Gun (Evidence 15) both indicate that a .38-caliber gun was used, which could tie into the cause of death being a stabbing as per the autopsy report. However, the lighter (Evidence 16) found with Athena's prints complicates things, but it's not directly related to the escape route contradiction.

In summary, the key contradiction is between the Security Camera Video showing Starbuck and Terran in the boarding lounge and Starbuck's testimony about taking a different escape route.
</think>
